channel.title: Dark Reading
channel.description: Dark Reading: Connecting the Information and Security Community
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2000-2021 Dark Reading - All rights reserved.

item.title: What Should I Know About Defending IoT Attack Surfaces?
item.description: The Internet of Things needs to be part of the overall corporate information security policy to prevent adversaries from using these devices as an entry point.
item.dc:creator: Bud Broomhead, CEO, Viakoo

item.title: Syxsense Enterprise Unifies Endpoint Security and IT Management for Real-Time Vulnerability Monitoring and Remediation
item.description: IT Teams can now manage, detect, and secure all endpoints with 100% visibility across desktop, laptop, server, and mobile devices.

item.title: API Security Company Traceable AI Lands $60 Million Series B
item.description: Latest round led by IVP values the company at $450 million.

item.title: SolarWinds Attackers Gear Up for Typosquatting Attacks
item.description: The same infrastructure traced back to Russian-speaking threat group Nobelium is being used to set up misspelled domain names, presaging impersonation attacks bent on credential harvesting, analysts say.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Unpatched DNS-Poisoning Bug Affects Millions of Devices, Stumps Researchers
item.description: The security vulnerability puts wide swaths of industrial networks and IoT devices at risk of compromise, researchers warn.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: REvil Revival: Are Ransomware Gangs Ever Really Gone?
item.description: The infamous ransomware group appears to be back from the dead — maybe — and using the old brand, but experts question whether a reconstituted gang will have much success.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Syxsense Launches Unified Endpoint Security and Management Platform
item.description: Syxsense Enterprise delivers real-time vulnerability monitoring and remediation for all endpoints across an organization’s entire network.

item.title: Third-Party App Access Is the New Executable File
item.description: By providing these apps and other add-ons for SaaS platforms and associated permissions, businesses present bad actors with more opportunities to gain access to company data.
item.dc:creator: Maor Bin, Co-Founder and CEO, Adaptive Shield

item.title: How to Create a Cybersecurity Mentorship Program
item.description: As the talent shortage rages on, companies have found mentorship programs to be one of the best ways to obtain the security skills they need to develop their existing teams.
item.dc:creator: Steve Zurier, Contributing Writer

item.title: Radware Launches SkyHawk Security, a Spinoff of Its Cloud Native Protector Business
item.description: Tiger Global Management invests $35 million in SkyHawk Security to accelerate growth.

item.title: Teleport Raises $110 Million Series C at $1.1 Billion Valuation Led by Bessemer Venture Partners
item.description: Funding follows dramatic revenue growth as identity-based access requirements skyrocket.

item.title: OccamSec Unveils New Cybersecurity Platform
item.description: Providing continuous penetration testing with context, and a host of other features, the Incenter platform is built to give organizations what they need to effectively secure their environment.

item.title: Developing Software? Get Accountability Right First
item.description: Software accountability offers a fresh perspective for creating and managing digital products, mainly by making processes more reliable and transparent for every stakeholder.
item.dc:creator: Guillermo Perez, CEO and Co-Founder, Octobot

item.title: TLS Flaws Leave Avaya, Aruba Switches Open to Complete Takeover
item.description: In the latest incarnation of the TLStorm vulnerability, switches from Avaya and Aruba — and perhaps others — are susceptible to compromise from an internal attacker.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Google Offers $1.5M Bug Bounty for Android 13 Beta
item.description: The security vulnerability payout set bug hunters rejoicing, but claiming the reward is much, much easier said than done.
item.dc:creator: Tara Seals, Managing Editor, News

item.title: New Regulations in India Require Orgs to Report Cyber Incidents Within 6 Hours
item.description: CERT-In updates cybersecurity rules to include mandatory reporting, record-keeping, and more.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: DoD Scammed Out of $23M in Phishing Attack on Jet-Fuel Vendors
item.description: A California man faces prison time and steep fines stemming from cybertheft of US military funds intended to pay jet-fuel suppliers.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: 6 Best Practices to Ensure Kubernetes Security Meets Compliance Regulations
item.description: Security must be precise enough to meet compliance requirements without impeding DevOps and developer productivity. Here's how to strike that balance.
item.dc:creator: Glen Kosaka, Head of Product Security, SUSE

item.title: Name That Edge Toon: Flower Power
item.description: Come up with a clever caption, and our panel of experts will reward the winner with a $25 Amazon gift card.
item.dc:creator: John Klossner, Cartoonist

item.title: Security Stuff Happens: What Do You Do When It Hits the Fan?
item.description: Breaches can happen to anyone, but a well-oiled machine can internally manage and externally remediate in a way that won't lead to extensive damage to a company's bottom line. (Part 1 of a series.)
item.dc:creator: Tyler Farrar, CISO, Exabeam

item.title: 2022 Security Priorities: Staffing and Remote Work
item.description: A comprehensive security strategy balances technology, processes, and people — and hiring and retaining security personnel and securing the remote workforce are firmly people priorities.
item.dc:creator: Edge Editors, Dark Reading

item.title: Good News! IAM Is Near-Universal With SaaS
item.description: The less-good news: IAM only works for applications your IT department knows about, so watch for "shadow IT" programs installed or written by users that leave a security gap.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Critical Vulnerabilities Leave Some Network-Attached Storage Devices Open to Attack
item.description: QNAP and Synology say flaws in the Netatalk fileserver allow remote code execution and information disclosure.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Cloudflare Flags Largest HTTPS DDoS Attack It's Ever Recorded
item.description: This scale of this month's encrypted DDoS attack over HTTPS suggests a well-resourced operation, analysts say.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Take a Diversified Approach to Encryption
item.description: Encryption will break, so it's important to mix and layer different encryption methods.
item.dc:creator: Dr. Vincent Berk, Chief Strategy Officer, Quantum Xchange

item.title: Ambient.ai Expands Computer Vision Capabilities for Better Building Security
item.description: The AI startup releases new threat signatures to expand the computer vision platform’s ability to identify potential physical security incidents from camera feeds.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Managing Editor, Features, Dark Reading

item.title: Microsoft Patches Pair of Dangerous Vulnerabilities in Azure PostgreSQL
item.description: Flaws gave attackers a way to access other cloud accounts and databases, security vendor says.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: IT Teams Worry Staff Lack Cloud-Specific Skills
item.description: Security, cost, and reliability top the list of concerns IT teams have about their cloud operations, according to a recent report.
item.dc:creator: Edge Editors, Dark Reading

item.title: Capital One Ventures, Snowflake Ventures, Verizon Ventures, and Wipro Ventures Join Securonix $1B+ Growth Investment as Strategic Investors
item.description: Blue-chip companies deepen commitment based on success of long-standing customer and partner relationships and conviction of Securonix’s vision and hypergrowth potential.

item.title: The Ransomware Crisis Deepens, While Data Recovery Stalls
item.description: Higher probabilities of attack, soaring ransoms, and less chance of getting data back — the ransomware plague gets worse, and cyber insurance fails to be a panacea.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Bumblebee Malware Buzzes Into Cyberattack Fray
item.description: The sophisticated Bumblebee downloader is being used in ongoing email-borne attacks that could lead to ransomware infections.
item.dc:creator: Tara Seals, Managing Editor, News

item.title: Microsoft: Russia Using Cyberattacks in Coordination With Military Invasion of Ukraine
item.description: Six Russian state-backed threat actors have lunched 237 cyberattacks on Ukraine's infrastructure, new research from MIcrosoft shows.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Explainable AI for Fraud Prevention
item.description: As the use of AI- and ML-driven decision-making draws transparency concerns, the need increases for explainability, especially when machine learning models appear in high-risk environments.
item.dc:creator: David Utassy, Data Scientist, SEON

item.title: A Peek into Visa's AI Tools Against Fraud
item.description: Visa has invested heavily in data analytics and artificial intelligence over the past five years to secure the movement of money and keep fraud rates low.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Managing Editor, Features, Dark Reading

item.title: Doppler Takes on Secrets Management
item.description: The startup is the latest company to try to solve the problem of organizing and sharing secrets.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Managing Editor, Features, Dark Reading

item.title: Chinese APT Bronze President Mounts Spy Campaign on Russian Military
item.description: The war in Ukraine appears to have triggered a change in mission for the APT known as Bronze President (aka Mustang Panda).
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Synopsys to Acquire WhiteHat Security from NTT
item.description: Acquisition expands security software-as-a-service capabilities.

item.title: CISA: Log4Shell Was the Most-Exploited Vulnerability in 2021
item.description: Internet-facing zero-day vulnerabilities were the most commonly used types of bugs in 2021 attacks, according to the international Joint Cybersecurity Advisory (JCSA).
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Tenable's Bit Discovery Buy Underscores Demand for Deeper Visibility of IT Assets
item.description: The four-year-old firm, started by two industry veterans, focuses on gaining visibility into Internet-facing services as more companies seek insight into what attackers see.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Coca-Cola Investigates Data-Theft Claims After Ransomware Attack
item.description: The Stormous ransomware group is offering purportedly stolen Coca-Cola data for sale on its leak site, but the soda giant hasn't confirmed that the heist happened.

item.title: How Industry Leaders Should Approach Open Source Security
item.description: Here's how to reduce security risk and gain the benefits of open source software.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Nolan, Head of Product, Anaconda

item.title: 5-Year Vulnerability Trends Are Both Surprising and Sadly Predictable
item.description: What 5,800+ pentests show us: Companies have been struggling with the same known and preventable security bugs year over year. Bandwidth stands at the heart of the problem.

item.title: Log4j Attack Surface Remains Massive
item.description: Four months after the Log4Shell vulnerability was disclosed, most affected open source components remain unpatched, and companies continue to use vulnerable versions of the logging tool.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: How Do I Report My Security Program's ROI?
item.description: If security leaders focus on visibility and metrics, they can demonstrate their programs' value to company leadership and boards.
item.dc:creator: John Ayers, Vice President of Product, Advanced Detection & Response, Optiv

item.title: Tenable Acquires External Attack Surface Management Vendor for $44.5M
item.description: Acquisition will add Internet-facing attack surface mapping and monitoring to Tenable's internal asset management products.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: The Ins and Outs of Secure Infrastructure as Code
item.description: The move to IaC has its challenges but done right can fundamentally improve an organization's overall security posture.
item.dc:creator: Rory McCune, Cloud Native Security Advocate, Aqua Security

item.title: CISA Taps Veteran CISO Bob Lord for Technical Adviser Role
item.description: Lord previously spearheaded security for the Democratic National Committee and held leadership roles at companies including Yahoo, Rapid7, and Twitter.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: API Attacks Soar Amid the Growing Application Surface Area
item.description: With Web application programming interface (API) traffic growing quickly, the average cloud-focused company sees three times more attacks.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Cyber Conflict Overshadowed a Major Government Ransomware Alert
item.description: The FBI warns that ransomware targets are no longer predictably the biggest, richest organizations, and that attackers have leveled up to victimize organizations of all sizes.
item.dc:creator: Hitesh Sheth, CEO, Vectra

item.title: Introducing Apostro: A Risk Management Platform for Web3 Security
item.description: Apostro's system will monitor all transactions to identify malicious behavior that can cause damage to DeFi protocols.

item.title: SecurityScorecard Launches Cyber Risk Quantification Portfolio
item.description: SecurityScorecard's Cyber Risk Quantification portfolio helps customers understand the financial impact of a cyber-attack.

item.title: What the ECDSA Flaw in Java Means for Enterprises
item.description: This Tech Tip reminds developers and security teams to check what version of Java they are running. Whether they are vulnerable to the ECDSA flaw boils down to the version number.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Iranian Hacking Group Among Those Exploiting Recently Disclosed VMware RCE Flaw
item.description: Threat actor is using the flaw to deliver Core Impact backdoor on vulnerable systems, security vendor says.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: North Korean State Actors Deploying Novel Malware to Spy on Journalists
item.description: Spear-phishing campaign loaded with new "Goldbackdoor" malware targeted journalists with NK News, analysts found.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: When Security Meets Development: The DevSecOps Conundrum
item.description: The DevSecOps journey is well worth undertaking because it can improve communication, speed up development, and ensure quality products.
item.dc:creator: Srinivas Mukkamala, Senior Vice President, Security Products, Ivanti

item.title: Mastercard Launches Next-Generation Identity Technology with Microsoft
item.description: New 'trust' tool improves online experience and helps tackle digital fraud.

item.title: Ukraine Invasion Driving DDoS Attacks to All-Time Highs
item.description: Unprecedented numbers of DDoS attacks since February are the result of hacktivists' cyberwar against Russian state interests, researchers say.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Trend Micro Launches New Security Platform
item.description: An ecosystem of native and third-party integrations provides visibility and control across the entire attack surface.

item.title: Overlapping ICS/OT Mandates Distract From Threat Detection and Response
item.description: It's time for regulators of critical infrastructure — including industrial control systems and operational technology — to focus more on operational resiliency.
item.dc:creator: Mark Carrigan, Senior Vice President, Process Safety and OT Cybersecurity, Hexagon PPM

item.title: Many Medical Device Makers Skimp on Security Practices
item.description: Barely over a quarter of medical device companies surveyed maintain a software bill-of-materials, and less than half set security requirements at the design stage.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Sophos Buys Alert-Monitoring Automation Vendor
item.description: Acquisition of cloud-based alert security company will help Sophos automate tasks bogging down security teams, the company says.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Neustar Security Services’ UltraDNS Integrates Terraform for Streamlined, Automated DNS Management
item.description: UltraDNS Terraform Provider enhances productivity, change management.

item.title: FBI Warns Ransomware Attacks on Agriculture Co-ops Could Upend Food Supply Chain
item.description: Ransomware groups are looking to strike large agriculture cooperatives during strategic seasons, when they are most vulnerable, according to law enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Early Discovery of Pipedream Malware a Success Story for Industrial Security
item.description: Cybersecurity professionals discovered, analyzed, and created defenses against the ICS malware framework before it was deployed, but expect the stakes to keep rising.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Bitdefender Enhances Premium VPN Service With New Privacy Protection Technologies
item.description: New ad blocker and anti-tracker modules as well as whitelist capabilities provide consumers with secure and private Web browsing.

item.title: Contrast Security Introduces Cloud-Native Automation
item.description: New integrations enable Contrast capabilities to be delivered to Red Hat OpenShift users.

item.title: Forescout Enhances Continuum Platform With New OT Capabilities
item.description: New capabilities enable improved OT and IoT asset visibility along with data-powered threat detection and cost-effective deployments at scale.

item.title: PerimeterX Code Defender Extends Capability To Stop Supply Chain Attacks
item.description: Client-side web app security solution introduces features that give real-time visibility and control of the website attack surface, enabling businesses to stop PII theft and comply with data privacy regulations.

item.title: CyberUSA, and Superus Careers Launch Cyber Career Exchange Platform
item.description: Collaboration aimed at connecting talent and employers.

item.title: Fortress Information Security Receives $125M Strategic Investment from Goldman Sachs Asset Management
Comcast Business 2021 DDoS Threat Report: DDoS Becomes a Bigger Priority as Multivector Attacks are on the Rise
item.description: Comcast Business mitigated 24,845 multi-vector DDoS attacks in 2021, a 47 percent increase over 2020.

item.title: Creating Cyberattack Resilience in Modern Education Environments
item.description: From increasing cybersecurity awareness in staff, students, and parents to practicing good security hygiene for devices, using endpoint protection, and inspecting network traffic, schools can boost cybersecurity to keep students safe.
item.dc:creator: Michael J. Covington, Vice President of Portfolio Strategy, Jamf

item.title: Zero-Day Exploit Use Exploded in 2021
item.description: Ransomware and other financially motivated threat actors joined nation-state-backed groups in leveraging unpatched flaws in attack campaigns, new data shows.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: What Steps Do I Take to Shift Left in Security?
item.description: Security has benefited from shifting many late-cycle disciplines left or earlier in the cycle.
item.dc:creator: Vishal Jain, Co-Founder and CTO, Valtix

item.title: Devo Acquires Threat Hunting Company Kognos
item.description: Acquisition will blend autonomous threat hunting with cloud-native security analytics for automating security tasks.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Exploring Biometrics and Trust at the Corporate Level
item.description: Biometric measurements should be part of any multifactor authentication (MFA) strategy, but choose your methods carefully: Some only establish trust at the device level.
item.dc:creator: Kimberly Biddings, VP of Product, BIO-key International, Inc.

item.title: New Zscaler Research Shows Over 400% Increase in Phishing Attacks With Retail and Wholesale Industries at Greatest Risk
item.description: Annual ThreatLabz Report reveals phishing-as-a-service as the key source of attacks across critical industries and consumers globally; underscores urgency to adopt a zero-trust security model.

item.title: Cybereason Launches Digital Forensics Incident Response
item.description: Cybereason MalOp Detection Engine augmented with Nuanced DFIR Intelligence reduces the mean-time-to-detect and remediate incidents.

item.title: Alert Logic Releases MDR Incident Response Capability for Addressing a Breach
item.description: Seedrs Ltd. deployed and configured Alert Logic Intelligent Response in minutes, and immediately began blocking critical threats.

item.title: 3 Ways We Can Improve Cybersecurity
item.description: To better manage risks, companies can concentrate on resilience, sharing information to protect from cyber threats, and making the cybersecurity tent bigger by looking at workers with nontraditional skill sets.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Burkey, Chief Information Security Officer, HP

item.title: Anti-Fraud Partnership Brings Confidential Computing to Financial Services
item.description: Intel, FiVerity, and Fortanix team up to launch an AI-driven fraud detection platform into a confidential computing environment.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: LinkedIn Brand Now the Most Abused in Phishing Attempts
item.description: New research shows threat actors increasingly leveraging social networks for attacks, with LinkedIn being used in 52% of global phishing attacks.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Okta Wraps Up Lapsus$ Investigation, Pledges More Third-Party Controls
item.description: Companies must enforce more security on their own third-party providers and retain the ability to conduct independent investigations, experts say.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Denonia Malware Shows Evolving Cloud Threats
item.description: Cloud security is constantly evolving and consistently different than defending on-premises assets. Denonia, a recently discovered serverless cryptominer drives home the point.
item.dc:creator: Fernando Montenegro, Senior Principal Analyst, Omdia

item.title: CISA, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, & UK Issue Joint Advisory on Russian Cyber Threats
item.description: The Russian government is ratcheting up malicious cyberattacks against critical infrastructure in countries supporting Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: 6 Malware Tools Designed to Disrupt Industrial Control Systems (ICS)
item.description: Stuxnet was the first known malware built to attack operational technology environment. Since then, there have been several others.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: The Modern Software Supply Chain: How It's Evolved and What to Prepare For
item.description: Supply chain security attacks have been becoming increasingly common and more sophisticated. Find out how to remain secure throughout the software supply chain.

item.title: Incognia Introduces New Location-Based Device Authorization Solution
item.description: Module enables apps to establish trust in new devices without adding user friction.

item.title: Lightspin Secures Infrastructure as Code Files with New GitHub Integration
item.description: Users can scan GitHub repositories and detect misconfigurations, exposed secrets and other security issues.

item.title: How Russia Is Isolating Its Own Cybercriminals
item.description: Sanctions imposed by the Biden administration, coupled with Russia's proposed initiative to cut itself off from the global Internet, is causing cybercriminals to ponder their future.
item.dc:creator: Ian W. Gray, Senior Director, Research & Analysis, Flashpoint

item.title: Backward-Compatible Post-Quantum Communications Is a Matter of National Security
item.description: When a quantum computer can decipher the asymmetric encryption protecting our vital systems, Q-Day will arrive.
item.dc:creator: Pete Ford, Senior Vice President of Federal Operations, QuSecure

item.title: From Passive Recovery to Active Readiness
item.description: This is the shift that companies need to make after a cyberattack.
item.dc:creator: Shmulik Yehezkel, Chief Critical Cyber Operations Officer & CISO, CYE

item.title: Fortress Tackles Supply Chain Security, One Asset at a Time
item.description: Fortress Information Security will expand its Asset to Vendor Library to include hardware bill of materials and software bill of materials information.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Managing Editor, Features, Dark Reading

item.title: Microsoft Launches Purview Platform to Govern, Protect, and Manage Sensitive Data
item.description: The rebranded Microsoft Purview platform integrates Microsoft 365 Compliance and Azure Purview, and adds new capabilities and products to help manage data no matter where it resides.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Managing Editor, Features, Dark Reading

item.title: Millions of Lenovo Laptops Contain Firmware-Level Vulnerabilities
item.description: Three flaws present in consumer laptops can give attackers a way to drop highly persistent malware capable of evading methods to remove it, security vendor says.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: More Than Half of Initial Infections in Cyberattacks Come Via Exploits, Supply Chain Compromises
item.description: Mandiant data also shows a dramatic drop in attacker dwell time on victim networks in the Asia-Pacific region — to 21 days in 2021 from 76 days in 2020.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: RF Code Announces Sentry, a New Edge Solution for Remote Locations
item.description: Provides autonomous and uninterrupted monitoring of unmanned IT locations at scale.

item.title: New Kiteworks Report Reveals Significant Risk Maturity Gap
item.description: Over half of organizations admit their security and compliance controls for managing sensitive content communications—both internally and externally—are inadequate.

item.title: How to Interpret the EU's Guidance on DNS Abuse Worldwide
item.description: From higher standards in top-level domains to increased adoption of security controls, stepped-up measures can help fight DNS abuse and protect Web domains.
item.dc:creator: Justin Hartland, Product Director, Domain Management, CSC Global

item.title: Adversaries Look for 'Attackability' When Selecting Targets
item.description: A large number of enterprise applications are affected by the vulnerability in Log4j, but adversaries aren't just looking for the most common applications. They are looking for targets that are easier to exploit and/or have the biggest payoff.
item.dc:creator: Edge Editors, Dark Reading
